content:
MetadataSerializer Class

Definition

Provides support for Metadata Serialization

In this Article

public class MetadataSerializer
Inheritance
System.Object
MetadataSerializer

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

MetadataSerializer()

Initializes a new instance of the MetadataSerializer class with a default token serializer.

public MetadataSerializer ();

Remarks

The CertificateValidationModeRevocationMode and TrustedStoreLocation properties are initialized to the following values: System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultCertificateValidationMode, System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultRevocationMode, and System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultTrustedStoreLocation.

MetadataSerializer(SecurityTokenSerializer)

Initializes a new instance of the MetadataSerializer class that uses the specified token serializer.

public MetadataSerializer (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer tokenSerializer);
tokenSerializer
SecurityTokenSerializer

The token serializer that will be used to serialize security tokens.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

tokenSerializer is null.

Remarks

The CertificateValidationModeRevocationMode and TrustedStoreLocation properties are initialized to the following values: System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultCertificateValidationMode, System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultRevocationMode, and System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.DefaultTrustedStoreLocation.

Fields

LanguageAttribute

A string constant that defines the language attribute, “xml:lang”.

public const string LanguageAttribute;

LanguageLocalName

A string constant that defines the language local name, “lang”.

public const string LanguageLocalName;

LanguageNamespaceUri

A string constant that defines the language namespace URI, “http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace”.

public const string LanguageNamespaceUri;

LanguagePrefix

A string constant that defines the language prefix, “xml”.

public const string LanguagePrefix;

Properties

CertificateValidationMode

Gets or sets the validation mode of the X.509 certificate that is used to sign the metadata document.

public System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateValidationMode CertificateValidationMode { get; set; }
Value
X509CertificateValidationMode

One of the enumeration values that specifies the X.509 certificate validation mode. The default is specified by DefaultCertificateValidationMode.

CertificateValidator

Gets or sets the certificate validator for the X.509 certificate that is used to sign the metadata document.

public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator CertificateValidator { get; set; }
Value
X509CertificateValidator

The certificate validator for the X.509 certificate.

RevocationMode

Gets or sets the revocation mode of the X.509 certificate that is used to sign the metadata document.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode RevocationMode { get; set; }
Value
X509RevocationMode

One of the enumeration values that specifies the X.509 certificate revocation mode. The default is specified by DefaultRevocationMode.

SecurityTokenSerializer

Gets the token serializer that is used by the current instance to serialize security tokens.

public System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer SecurityTokenSerializer { get; }
Value
SecurityTokenSerializer

The token serializer that is used by the current instance.

TrustedIssuers

Gets the list of trusted issuers that are trusted to sign the metadata document by the current instance.

public System.Collections.Generic.List<string> TrustedIssuers { get; }
Value
List<String>

The list of trusted issuers.

TrustedStoreLocation

Gets or sets the trusted store location of the X.509 certificate that is used to sign the metadata document.

public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation TrustedStoreLocation { get; set; }
Value
StoreLocation

One of the enumeration values that specify the X.509 certificate store location. The default is specified by DefaultTrustedStoreLocation.

GetMetadataSigningCertificate(SecurityKeyIdentifier)

Gets the X.509 certificate created from the specified key identifier.

protected virtual System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 GetMetadataSigningCertificate (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier ski);
ski
SecurityKeyIdentifier

The key identifier from which to create the X.509 certificate.

Returns
X509Certificate2

The X.509 certificate that was created from the specified key identifier.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

ski is null.

InvalidOperationException

Cannot find a key identifier clause of type X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause in ski. Enforces the default behavior, you can override this method to support other key identifier clauses.

Remarks

By default, this method only supports key identifier clauses of type X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause. You can override this method to support other kinds of key identifier clauses. This method is invoked by the ValidateSigningCredential method.

ValidateIssuer(X509Certificate2)

Validates the X.509 certificate that signed the metadata document against the trusted issuers list specified by the stem.IdentityModel.Metadata.MetadataSerializer.TrustedIssuers* property. This method is invoked by the stem.IdentityModel.Metadata.MetadataSerializer.ValidateSigningCredential* method.

protected virtual void ValidateIssuer (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 signingCertificate);
signingCertificate
X509Certificate2

The signing certificate.

Remarks

By default, this method does not perform any validation. Provide your own implementation to perform trusted issuer validation.
